results.title: Texture (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Paul Burnford and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Art in Action”
Studies in hard, rough, soft, smooth surfaces provide a tangible approach to understanding textural qualities in art. Points out the various textural effects which can be achieved with clay, metals, paper, linoleum, and other art materials.

results.title: Textiles and ornamental arts of India
results.creator_credit: Ray Eames, Charles Eames, Encyclopaedia Britannica Films and Eames
results.brief_description: Displays the variety, sophistication, and beauty of India’s textiles and ornamental arts in a unique filmic interpretation of a exhibition at the Museum of Modern Art in New York City. Captures the flavour of Indian traditions and philosophy, and explores the spiritual significance of art in the everyday life of the Indian people.

results.title: Textiles
results.creator_credit: John C. Elder and Gaumont-British Instructional
results.brief_description: A comprehensive survey of the Scottish textile industry, showing the relation between the centres of the various industries and the resources of raw materials and driving-power for the mills. The process of manufacture of tweeds, linen, sailcloth from jute, and cotton and silk thread are shown in detail.
results.description: A comprehensive survey of the Scottish textile industry, showing the relation between the centres of the various industries and the resources of raw materials and driving-power for the mills. results.title: Text rain
results.brief_description: TEXT RAIN is a playful interactive installation that blurs the boundary between the familiar and the magical. Participants in TEXT RAIN installation use familiar instruments of their bodies, to do what seems magical - to lift and play with falling letters that do not really exist. In the TEXT RAIN installation participants stand or move in front of a large projection screen. On the screen they see a mirrored video projection of themselves in black and white, combined with colour animation of falling text. Like rain or snow, the text appears to land on the participants heads and arms. The text responds to the participants mentions and can be caught, lifted, and then let fall again. The falling text will land on anything darker than a certain threshold, and fall whenever that obstacle is removed.

results.title: Texasville
results.creator_credit: Peter Bogdanovich, Barry Spikings, Cine-Source and Nelson Entertainment
results.brief_description: Twenty years after his acclaimed “The Last Picture Show”, Peter Bogdanovich returns to the small town of Texasville to investigate what happened to the characters who inhabited the initial film. Duane (Jeff Bridges) is now an oil businessman whose company is going broke and his marriage to the vivacious Karla (Annie Potts) is on the rocks. A chance encounter with his old high school flame Jayce (Cybil Shepherd) precipitates a mid-life crisis for Duane and he begins to question his philandering and his refusal to let go of the past. The performances are what makes this film wonderful, with excellent performances by the entire cast. Engaging and humane, “Texasville” is a bittersweet elegy to growing old and the slowly extinguishing values of small-town life. Based on the novel by Larry McMurty.

results.title: Texas: Instant Cities
results.brief_description:
Episode number 9 of Series “Architecture at the Crossroads Series”.
Part of a series which examines the main themes in world architecture, the work of architects who are at the centre of the current debate and introduces younger architects who are beginning to make a name for themselves. Part Nine deals with Texas, which issues more building permissions each year than any other State. Houston and Dallas have consequently become the most exciting cities in which to look at architecture. These “pop-up” cities are like a blackboard on which the problems of modern architecture are being chalked up. They show the 21st Century in the making - a prospect that is intriguing, daring and deeply disturbing.

results.title: Tetsuo: the iron man
results.brief_description: This film has lent itself to comparison with the work of Lynch and Cronenberg, as it tells its story using a violent array of flashbacks, fast-forwards and nightmarish dream sequences. The action centres around a young metal fetishist who tries to insert pieces of metal into his own skin. Running out into the street he is knocked down by a car and the accident gives him strange powers as his body begins to painfully mutate into a synergy of flesh and metal. Meanwhile the salaryman who ran him down finds his own body is also transforming into a metallic monster. This bizarre, sexual fantasy mixes black humour and sexual imagery with a hypnotic post-industrial soundtrack. In Japanese with English subtitles.

results.title: Testing, testing
results.brief_description: Introduces the behind the scenes work done by scientific testers in Britain prior to placement of products on the market. Shows amongst others the tests done on custard powder, petrol tankers, tonic water, fly killer, vacuum cleaners and grass.

results.title: Testing vision in the pre-school child
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Child development series”.
A child’s visual competence includes not only visual acuity but also his ability to attach meaning to what he sees. The tests begin at six months and various procedures are demonstrated with children at 2 1/4, 3 1/2, 4 1/2, 5 and 6 years

results.title: Testing multiple handicapped children
results.brief_description: Demonstrates how to evaluate the potential abilities of pre-school children with single and multiple handicaps, by testing three children of varying disabilities and backgrounds: Kevin is unable to move without help, Millie cannot speak and is mentally retarded, and Jimmie has poor hearing and sight, and is suspected of mental retardation
